page.title: 06LOCAL HISTORY_COPMANTHORPE
page.content: The Knights Templars a group of fight ing monks during the time of the Cru_ sades held the Manor of Copmanthorpe from 1284 to 1312 when they were sup_ pressed and their lands made over to the Knights Hospitallers. LISTED BUILDINGS ------------------ Part of Copmanthorpe has been desig_ nated as a conservation area.Here are 7 listed building in the village..... 1_St Giles church built in 1180. 2_Ashfield.Station Road.A fine Georg_ ian house. 3_Travel House Farm.Main St,early 19th century. 4_Paddock's House,Main St built betw_ een 1680_1700. 6_Manor farm house,Main St built 1710. 7_Oaklea. Main St,Queen Anne house. Early 18th century.
